artists.biography:
Matthew Charles "Matt" Berry (born 2 May 1974) is an English actor, writer, comedian and musician. Berry is perhaps best known for his appearances in The IT Crowd, Garth Marenghi's Darkplace, The Mighty Boosh, and Snuff Box. He is renowned for his deep voice; he has voiced several advertisements, most notably for Volvic, The Natural Confectionery Company, Absolute Radio, and MoneySupermarket.

As a musician, Berry composed all the music for Snuff Box, as well as the music for AD/BC: A Rock Opera, which he co-wrote with Richard Ayoade. AD/BC was a half-hour parody of overblown musicals in general and Jesus Christ Superstar in particular, telling the story of the innkeeper who allowed Mary, Joseph, and the baby Jesus to sleep in his manger. AD/BC was broadcast in December 2004 and featured Fulcher and Mighty Boosh stars Julian Barratt and Noel Fielding. He also performed a song for an episode of Garth Marenghi's Darkplace entitled "One Track Lover", a spoof of cheesy romantic 80s songs.
artists.name: Matt Berry

Matt Berry.biography:
Matthew Charles "Matt" Berry (born 2 May 1974) is an English actor, writer, comedian and musician. Berry is perhaps best known for his appearances in The IT Crowd, Garth Marenghi's Darkplace, The Mighty Boosh, and Snuff Box. He is renowned for his deep voice; he has voiced several advertisements, most notably for Volvic, The Natural Confectionery Company, Absolute Radio, and MoneySupermarket.

As a musician, Berry composed all the music for Snuff Box, as well as the music for AD/BC: A Rock Opera, which he co-wrote with Richard Ayoade. AD/BC was a half-hour parody of overblown musicals in general and Jesus Christ Superstar in particular, telling the story of the innkeeper who allowed Mary, Joseph, and the baby Jesus to sleep in his manger. AD/BC was broadcast in December 2004 and featured Fulcher and Mighty Boosh stars Julian Barratt and Noel Fielding. He also performed a song for an episode of Garth Marenghi's Darkplace entitled "One Track Lover", a spoof of cheesy romantic 80s songs.

release_name_spotify: Matt Berry and the Maypoles Live

wiki.content: "Opium" is a 2008 musical album by Matt Berry, released during his simultaneous foray into comedy. Departing from his comedic personas, the album combines narrative monologues and music. Notable for its prog-rock keyboard in "Introduction," the album features emotionally resonant tracks like "Reach for the Ground" and the signature "Love is a Fool." Exploring pastoral psych-pop in "Lay Your Love On Me," Berry's comedic elements are balanced by impressive multi-instrumental proficiency. The middle segment, initially dense, reveals charms with repeated listens. The album maintains momentum with tunes like "Hot Dog" and "Jet Setter," seamlessly blending comedic characters with compelling compositions. Closing with "One More Hit," "Opium" leaves a lasting impression, showcasing Berry's musical brilliance. Despite its unique qualities, Berry deemed the work subpar and removed it from streaming services, contributing to its elusive nature. While public perception of Berry's music alongside comedy may be uncertain, his later albums have found appreciation. "Opium" stands as a unique contemporary offering, inviting listeners into its distinct universe filled with memorable hooks, choruses, and musical brilliance, urging them to explore its private musical realm. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
